result.execSummary:
The defendant Alissa J Bartholomew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Court Costs and DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling or other approved activity by Agent.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
No contact with Pick N Save or Walmart.
Court denies request for expunction.

Case 14CF1049 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1082.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alissa J Bartholomew in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 4 months jail straight time - concurrent to Ct. 2 STAYED for 18 months Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2
- Court Costs of $243.00 - APPLY BAIL 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - APPLY BAIL
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Any valid prescriptoin drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of all prescriptions. Full time employment and/or combination of schooling or other approved activity by Agent.  No contact with Pick n' Save or Walmart.  

CT. 2:
- 4 months jail straight time - concurrent to Ct. 1 STAYED for 18 months Probation - concurrent to Ct 1
- Court Costs of $243.00 - APPLY BAIL 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - APPLY BAIL
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s.  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Any valid prescriptoin drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; inform agent of all prescriptions. Full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with Pick n' Save or Walmart.

State opposes expunction
